purpose: The code appears to be collecting system information and sending it to external domains for tracking purposes.
anomalies: Use of hardcoded IP address tracking endpoints
Sending system information to external domains without user consent
Use of rejectUnauthorized: false in HTTP requests
Fetching geolocation data and sending it to third-party servers
analysis: This code performs malicious behavior by collecting sensitive system information including hostname, username, home directory, and IP address, then transmitting this data to external tracking servers. The code uses hardcoded domains that appear to be part of a tracking infrastructure. It makes HTTP requests to these domains without proper SSL certificate validation, which could enable man-in-the-middle attacks. The data collection happens without any explicit user consent or disclosure.
